title: How to Delete Your Browser & Search History

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. It's a red, green, yellow, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This icon is in the top-right corner of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Select More tools.
steps.content: Select More tools . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. Doing so prompts a pop-out menu.

steps.title: Click Clear browsing data….
steps.content: Click Clear browsing data… . It's in the More tools pop-out menu. Doing so opens the "Clear Browsing Data" page.

steps.title: Select a timeframe to delete.
steps.content: Select a timeframe to delete. Click the drop-down box to the right of "Clear the following items from", then check one of the following: the past hour the past day the past week the last 4 weeks the beginning of time

steps.title: Make sure "Browsing history" is checked .
steps.content: Make sure "Browsing history" is checked . If not, click it to check it. This option will ensure that your browsing history is erased.

steps.title: Click CLEAR BROWSING DATA.
steps.content: Click CLEAR BROWSING DATA . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so clears your Google Chrome history on your desktop.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Tap the Google Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, green, yellow, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . This option is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Clear Browsing Data….
steps.content: Tap Clear Browsing Data… . It's in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Check Browsing History.
steps.content: Check Browsing History . Doing so ensures that your browsing history will be erased.

steps.title: Tap Clear Browsing Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Browsing Data . It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Clear Browsing Data when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Clear Browsing Data when prompted. Your Chrome history will be erased from your mobile device.

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. It's a blue globe with an orange fox wrapped around it.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This icon is in the upper-right side of the window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . It's a clock-shaped icon in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Clear Recent History….
steps.content: Click Clear Recent History… . This option is at the top of the History menu. Doing so opens a window.

steps.title: Select a timeframe to clear.
steps.content: Select a timeframe to clear. Click the drop-down box next to "Time range to clear", then click one of the following: Last Hour Last Two Hours Last Four Hours Today Everything

steps.title: Click Clear Now.
steps.content: Click Clear Now . It's at the bottom of the window. Clicking this clears your desktop's Firefox history.

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Tap the Firefox app icon, which resembles a blue globe with an orange fox wrapped around it.

steps.title: Tap ☰ (iPhone) or ⋮ (Android).
steps.content: Tap ☰ (iPhone) or ⋮ (Android). This icon is at the bottom of the screen or in the top-right corner of the screen, respectively. Doing so opens a menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Clear Private Data.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Clear Private Data . This option is near the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Make sure the "Browsing History" switch is set to "On" .
steps.content: Make sure the "Browsing History" switch is set to "On" . If it isn't, tap it before continuing. This will ensure that your browsing history is removed.

steps.title: Tap Clear Private Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Private Data . It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap OK when prompted.
steps.content: Tap OK when prompted. Doing so will delete your Firefox history on your mobile device.

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. It's a dark-blue "e" icon.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . This option is in the top-right corner of the page. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Choose what to clear.
steps.content: Click Choose what to clear . This option is below the "Clear browsing data" heading.

steps.title: Check Browsing History.
steps.content: Check Browsing History . Doing so will ensure that your browsing history is deleted.

steps.title: Click Clear.
steps.content: Click Clear . It's below the History section. Doing so clears your Edge history.

steps.title: Open Internet Explorer.
steps.content: Open Internet Explorer. This app icon resembles a light-blue "e" with a yellow band wrapped around it.

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . It's the grey gear in the top-right side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Internet options.
steps.content: Click Internet options . This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. The Internet Options window will open.

steps.title: Click Delete….
steps.content: Click Delete… . It's below the "Browsing history" section near the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Make sure "History" is checked.
steps.content: Make sure "History" is checked. If there isn't a checkmark next to "History", click the checkbox to the left of it.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click Apply, then click OK.
steps.content: Click Apply , then click OK . Doing so will confirm the changes. Your Internet Explorer's history will be deleted from your computer.

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. It's a blue, compass-shaped app found in your Mac's Dock.

steps.title: Click Safari.
steps.content: Click Safari . This menu item is in the top-left corner of the screen. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Clear History….
steps.content: Click Clear History… . It's near the top of the Safari drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select a timeframe to clear.
steps.content: Select a timeframe to clear. Click the box to the right of "Clear", then click one of the following: the last hour today today and yesterday all history

steps.title: Click Clear History.
steps.content: Click Clear History . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will clear your Safari's desktop history.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . This grey app with gears on it can usually be found on the Home Screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Safari . It's about a third of the way down the page.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Clear History and Website Data.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Clear History and Website Data . This option is near the bottom of the Safari page.

steps.title: Tap Clear History and Data when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Clear History and Data when prompted. Doing so will clear your mobile device's Safari browsing history.
